result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy T Gruener

defendant.name: Gruener, Jeremy T
defendant.address: W5925 Mariner Hills Trl, Elkhorn, WI 53121

records.addlTxt:
2:03 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jeremy T Gruener.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization.  Atty. Menden provide an update; she is waiting for the Walworth County case to resolve first.  Atty. Menden requests a further proceedings date in about 60 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

10:06 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jeremy T Gruener.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Menden provides an update, there is an underlying matter in another County and she would like to wait to see what the outcome is in that matter before proceedings in this one.  Atty. Menden requests another further proceedings after October 10.  No objection from the State.  Court will adjourn for status in November with the hopes that the underlying matter will be finished or resolved by then.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Menden as counsel of record for the defendant.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

03:55 PM Defendant Jeremy T Gruener in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
